title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON – In a performance that transcended the game itself, Karl Malone authored a masterpiece, carrying the Utah Jazz to a grueling 105-100 victory over the Houston Rockets. The Mailman delivered with historic force, pouring in a game-high 47 points to go with 14 rebounds in a display of sheer dominance.

From the opening tip, this was Malone’s showcase. The Houston defense had no answer for the powerhouse forward, who battered his way to the basket with unstoppable momentum. Every turnaround jumper, every powerful drive through the lane, and every trip to the free-throw line chipped away at the Rockets’ resolve. His 47 points were not just a number; they were the relentless, pounding heart of the Jazz’s offense.

While Malone was the undeniable force, he received crucial support. John Stockton, the other half of the legendary duo, orchestrated the attack with 14 assists and chipped in 13 points, ensuring the offense ran through its primary weapon. Jeff Hornacek provided a vital secondary scoring punch with 19 points.

Houston fought valiantly, led by Clyde Drexler’s 27 points and Hakeem Olajuwon’s 20 points and 16 rebounds. Yet, every time the Rockets mounted a charge, Malone answered. In the final, tense minutes, it was his unwavering composure and punishing efficiency that sealed the hard-fought win.

On this night, the story was singular and spectacular. It was not merely a game between two contenders; it was the night Karl Malone etched his name into the annals of the game with a legendary, 47-point tour de force.
